question_sentence: Ancient graves believed to have belonged to Knights Templar from the 12th century have been rediscovered in which English county?
evidence: Historian Edward Spencer Dyas said eight ancient graves in the churchyard of St Mary’s, in Enville, Staffordshire, could belong to Knights Templar, members of a medieval religious military order. The researcher said the discovery means the 12th-century church could be “one of the most nationally important churches in the country”

question_sentence: What type of health hazard is currently increasingly rapidly in the UK?
evidence: Pest control company Rentokil has reported a 65% year-on-year increase in bed-bug infestations. The rise has been attributed to the popularity of recycling furniture, as well as a resurgence of travel since the pandemic.

question_sentence: Harrison Ford has had a new species of which animal named after him?
evidence: Harrison Ford has had a species of Peruvian snake named after him – the Tachymenoides harrisonfordi – in honour of his environmental work as vice-chair of Conservation International. Ford’s legendary Indiana Jones character famously fears snakes, but the actor said he likes serpents and “found a quick kinship with this one”. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which airline hit the headlines after charging an elderly couple £110 to print new boarding passes?
evidence: Ruth Jaffe, 79, and her husband Peter, 80, were forced to pay the fee after they “accidentally downloaded their return boarding passes instead of the outgoing ones for a flight to France”, reported The Guardian. The couple told BBC Radio 4’s “Today” programme that the airline’s “confusing” website design had led to the error. Find out more on this week’s episode of The Week Unwrapped.

question_sentence: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has ruled out a Brexit-style referendum on which 2019 Conservative manifesto pledge?
choices: Introduction of a points-based immigration system
evidence: MPs from the Conservative right and so-called “Red Wall” Tories are among those pressing Sunak to commit to a vote on the issue, but the PM told ITV News that “most people are committed to getting to net zero”.

question_sentence: In this week’s World Cup semi-final against Australia, which Lioness scored the decisive third goal?
evidence: The reigning European champions will play in their first ever World Cup final, taking on Spain on Sunday after defeating Australia 3-1. The game will mark the first time any senior England football side has reached a World Cup final since 1966.

question_sentence: Candidates for the Republican presidential nomination headed to which campaign-opening state summer fair last weekend?
evidence: Donald Trump, his former vice-president Mike Pence and Florida governor Ron DeSantis kicked off their bids for the Republican presidential nomination at the state fair in Iowa last weekend. Although the caucuses are not until January, the Iowa State Fair is a “rite of passage for presidential candidates”, said John McCormick at The Wall Street Journal.

question_sentence: The shock winner of Argentina’s presidential primary elections, far-right candidate Javier Milei famously claims to be what?
evidence: Javier Milei sent the value of the peso plummeting when he pulled off a landslide win in the primary elections. The far-right economics professor “shot to daytime TV fame” in the 2010s, said The Guardian, as a self-described “tantric sex coach who spoke openly about his preference for threesomes”.

question_sentence: The Metropolitan Police has launched an investigation after several items were found to have been “missing, stolen or damaged” from which major museum?
evidence: After “what is believed to be the largest breach of security in a decade”, said The Times, the British Museum announced yesterday that an employee has been dismissed and will face legal action. No arrests have yet been made and the museum is conducting an independent review into what happened. “The irreplaceable items” that were “taken from the vaults” include gold jewellery, semi-precious gemstones and glass dating from the 15th-century BC to the 19th-century AD, said The Telegraph.

question_sentence: Michael Oher, the real-life subject of Oscar-winning film “The Blind Side”, has accused his adoptive parents Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy of what?
choices: Concealing communication from his birth parents
Getting him to sign papers making them his conservators
Selling personal stories about his wife to the press
evidence: The ex-American football star has claimed that unlike in the Hollywood version of events, the Tuohys did not adopt Oher. Instead, they lied and got him to sign papers making them his conservators. The family has said they are “devastated” by the allegations, which they deny.

question_sentence: What is the name of the hurricane threatening to dump heavy rain on parts of California and the Southwest?
evidence: Hilary is forecast to intensify into a Category 4 hurricane with winds of at least 130 mph before weakening significantly as it potentially reaches Southern California and parts of the Southwest this weekend.

question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump was indicted in Georgia this week for his alleged efforts to overturn his 2020 election defeat. How many times has Trump been indicted in total?
evidence: Donald Trump is the first current or former president in US history to face criminal charges. His 2024 presidential bid is going full steam ahead despite his four indictments.

question_sentence: A NASA telescope recently spotted a phenomenon in deep space that looked like which symbol?
evidence: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope captured an image of a cosmic object shaped like a glowing question mark. Scientists believe it could be the interaction of two colliding galaxies.

question_sentence: Which former NFL star announced he will become a college professor at his alma mater this fall?
evidence: Former NFL and University of Tennessee star quarterback Peyton Manning is returning to his alma mater to teach at the school’s College of Communication.

question_sentence: Approximately how many people are still unaccounted for in the wake of Maui’s devastating wildfires?
evidence: The number of people still unaccounted for in Maui is “probably still over 1,000,” Hawaii Gov. Josh Green told CNN on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Which US political figure set off a social media frenzy after sharing details about an experience with “magic mushrooms?”
evidence: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen confirmed in a CNN interview this week that she ate a dish at a restaurant that contained “magic mushrooms” on a recent trip to Beijing, but was unaware the mushrooms had hallucinogenic properties.

question_sentence: US gas prices hit 10-month highs this week at an average of $3.88 a gallon nationally on Thursday. How many states are already paying an average of $4 or more for gas?
evidence: As of Thursday, drivers in 12 states plus Washington, DC, were paying an average of $4 or more for gas, including Colorado, Arizona and Illinois, according to AAA. Indiana, Pennsylvania and New York aren’t far behind.

question_sentence: Which country is reeling from the shock of a tragic landslide at a jade mine?
evidence: A landslide at a jade mine in northern Myanmar killed at least 32 people, a local fire services official told CNN on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Which type of product received a sweeping recall this week over concerns of fire and burn hazards?
evidence: Chinese home appliance manufacturer Gree is recalling 1.5 million dehumidifiers following reports of 23 units catching on fire, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission said.

question_sentence: Which coffee chain is releasing boozy versions of some of its popular drinks?
evidence: Dunkin’ is turning two of its most popular drinks into boozy beverages.

question_sentence: What was the status of the Lahaina fire containment as of the evening of Aug. 14?
What is the name of the dog mentioned in the article who spent 942 days at a shelter before being permanently adopted?
What was one of the proposed solutions to address concerns about safety in New Castle County's parks?
choices: Increasing the number of park events
Enhancing the permitting process for overcrowded parks

question_sentence: What is one of the changes that Delaware Park's $10 million renovation project includes?
choices: Renovating the racetrack and sports betting areas
Adding a new area for high-limit table games
Closing down the casino during renovations
Reducing the number of slot machines

question_sentence: What is the age requirement for students enrolling in the "Foundations of Brewing Science and Brewery Operations" course at the University of Delaware?
What is the focus of the early childhood innovation center proposed by Delaware State University near the Dover Mall?
choices: Redesigning traffic patterns in the area
Creating a new shopping complex for children's products
Improving access and support for early childhood educators
Developing a new theme park centered around childhood education

question_sentence: What traffic charge was the man, Johnathan Guessford, cited for after giving state police officers the middle finger in a confrontation?
choices: An improper hand gesture associated with non-motorized vehicles

question_sentence: What areas are being targeted for cell tower proposals in New Castle County?
What led to the resumption of the defamation lawsuit against Lauren Witzke?
choices: The defendant, Eric Vaughn, dropped the lawsuit.
New evidence emerged that supported Eric Vaughn's claims.
A Texas judge reversed her previous ruling
Lauren Witzke publicly apologized for her statements.

question_sentence: What were the charges that Camden's former mayor, Justin T. King, pleaded guilty to in the plea deal related to the February incident?
